intro: Eurybia conocephala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are showy, with a distinctive bell-shaped structure and blue or purple petals, often appearing in late summer. Eurybia conocephala thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
